org.tms.api

Interface TableRowColumnElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseElement, Derivable, Labeled, Listenable, TableElement, Taggable, TimeSeriesable, Validatable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Column, Row

    public interface TableRowColumnElement
extends TableElement, Derivable, TimeSeriesable, Validatable
    Methods common to Table Rows and Columns,

    Since:
    "1.0"
    Version:
    "1.3"

      • export

        void export(java.lang.String fileName,
            IOOption<?> options)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Exports this TableRowColumnElement to the specified file format using the export options given in options.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name where the row/column is written to
        options - the IOOption that specifies the output file format as well as any specific export options
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fileName or options are null
        java.io.IOException - if fileName cannot be created
        See Also:
        CSVOptions.Default, DOCOptions.Default, HTMLOptions.Default, PDFOptions.Default, RTFOptions.Default, XLSOptions.Default, XMLOptions.Default

      • export

        void export(java.io.OutputStream out,
            IOOption<?> options)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Exports this TableRowColumnElement in the specified file format to the specified OutputStream using the export options given in options.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream where the TableRowColumnElement data is exported to
        options - the IOOption that specifies the output file format as well as any specific export options
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if out or options are null
        java.io.IOException - if out cannot be written to
        See Also:
        CSVOptions.Default, DOCOptions.Default, HTMLOptions.Default, PDFOptions.Default, RTFOptions.Default, XLSOptions.Default, XMLOptions.Default

      • sort

        void sort()
        Sort the table by a row/column. Null elements are sorted to the end of the row/column. Numeric cells are given sort order priority. All other cells are sorted by the natural order of the cell value interpreted as a String.

      • sort

        void sort(java.util.Comparator<Cell> cellSorter)
        Sort the table by a row/column. Null elements are sorted to the end of the row/column. Numeric cells are given sort order priority. All other cells are sorted by the natural order of the cell value interpreted as a String.
        Parameters:
        cellSorter - An instance of Comparator that is used to sort non-null row/column cells.

      • getCell

        Cell getCell(Access mode,
             java.lang.Object... mda)
        Return the Cell identified by Access mode/mda.
        Parameters:
        mode - the Access mode used to identify the Cell
        mda - optional information determined by mode
        Returns:
        the identified Table Cell

        TableRowColumnElement setCurrent()
        Set this Row or Column as current in the parent Table.
        Returns:
        the previous current Row/Column
